p: In the earliest stage of the epidemic, as 55% of the patients were related to a seafood and wet animal market, a likely zoonotic origin was suggested ( Sun et al., 2020). Researches have indicated that SARS-CoV-2 has close structural resemblance with bat coronaviruses, supporting the theory that SARS-CoV-2 was derived from bats. Snakes have also been suggested as a likely wildlife repository of the virus. However, there was an exponential rise in unrelated cases since late December 2019 ( Sun et al., 2020). Since bats are a natural reservoir of various coronaviruses, a zoonotic angle is not entirely ruled out. But statistics reveal that the disease is spreading rapidly by human-to-human transmission ( Guo et al., 2020).
